theme.title: Theme
theme.description: Choose your preferred color theme. System option follows your operating system settings.

dayNightShading.title: Day/Night Shading
dayNightShading.description: Show day/night background shading on 24-hour glucose graphs.

geekStats.title: Geek Stats
geekStats.description: Show technical details like AI prompts and detailed data tables. These are helpful for advanced users who want to see the underlying data and prompts.

exportFormat.title: Export Format
exportFormat.description: Choose the format for exporting table data to clipboard (CSV or TSV).

uiLanguage.title: UI Language
uiLanguage.description: Choose the language for the application interface. This affects all menus, labels, and button text throughout the application.

responseLanguage.title: AI Response Language
responseLanguage.syncDescription: When enabled, the AI response language will automatically match your UI language. When disabled, you can select a specific language below.
responseLanguage.description: Choose the language for AI analysis responses. This affects all AI-generated insights and recommendations.

unit.title: Glucose Unit
unit.description: Choose your preferred unit for displaying blood glucose values. This setting affects all glucose readings, charts, and thresholds throughout the app.

insulinDuration.title: Insulin Duration
insulinDuration.description: Set the duration of insulin action in hours for IOB (Insulin On Board) calculations. This affects how long insulin is considered active in your system. Typical values range from 3 to 6 hours.
insulinDuration.label: Duration (hours)

ai.title: AI Configuration
ai.description: Configure your AI settings for intelligent analysis. Click "Select" next to any configured API key to switch providers.

dataHandling.title: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Data Handling & Your Responsibility
dataHandling.summary: Your health data is sent to AI providers when using analysis features.
dataHandling.description1: When you use AI analysis features, your sensitive health data will be sent to the selected AI provider. The data is sent
dataHandling.description2: (such as your name or email), but the AI provider may be able to associate your API key with the health data you send.
dataHandling.responsibilityText: You are responsible for the security of this information and its use in accordance with all applicable data protection rules and regulations. Review the privacy policies of your chosen AI provider before using these features.
dataHandling.bestPracticesText: Monitor your API key usage regularly through your provider's dashboard, apply least privilege access permissions when creating API keys, and set daily spending limits to prevent unexpected charges and unauthorized usage.

storage.title: API Key Storage:
storage.summary: Your API keys are stored locally in your browser and never sent to our servers.
storage.description: Your API keys are stored locally in your browser's local storage (not cookies) and persist until you manually clear them or clear your browser data. The keys are never transmitted to our servers or any third party.
storage.technicalDetailsText: We use browser local storage API, which provides persistent storage that remains available across browser sessions. This data is stored only on your device and is accessible only by this web application from the same domain.

communication.title: AI Communication:
communication.summary: All AI analysis happens directly between your browser and the AI provider‚Äîno intermediary servers.
communication.description: When you request AI analysis, your browser sends the request directly to the selected AI provider's API. Our application does not act as an intermediary‚Äîthe communication goes straight from your browser to the AI provider.
communication.priorityText: If multiple API keys are configured, they are used in this order: Perplexity ‚Üí Grok AI ‚Üí DeepSeek ‚Üí Google Gemini. To use a different provider, remove the API keys with higher priority.

bestPractices.title: Security Best Practices:
bestPractices.summary: Follow these recommendations to keep your API keys and data secure.
bestPractices.createSecureText: Use minimal permissions when creating API keys at:
bestPractices.protectKeysText: Choose keys designated for client-side applications and set spending limits to prevent unexpected charges. Monitor your API key usage regularly through your provider's dashboard.
bestPractices.riskMitigationText: If someone gains access to your browser session or computer, they could potentially access your stored API key. To reduce this risk:
bestPractices.riskItem2: Use browser privacy features (private/incognito mode when appropriate)
bestPractices.riskItem4: Monitor your API usage in your provider's dashboard
bestPractices.riskItem5: Clear browser data when using public computers
